original_data.question: In a study, 2 groups are placed on different statin medications, statin A and statin B. Baseline LDL levels are drawn for each group and are subsequently measured every 3 months for 1 year. Average baseline LDL levels for each group were identical. The group receiving statin A exhibited an 11 mg/dL greater reduction in LDL in comparison to the statin B group. Statistical analysis reports a p-value of 0.052. Which of the following best describes the meaning of this p-value?

options.A: If 100 similar experiments were conducted, 5.2 of them would show similar results
options.B: There is a 5.2% chance that A is more effective than B is due to chance
options.C: There is a 94.8% chance that the difference observed reflects a real difference
options.D: This is a statistically significant result

model_response:
The p-value of 0.052 means that there is a 5.2% chance that statin A is more effective than statin B is due to chance. In other words, there is a 94.8% chance that the difference observed reflects a real difference.

Answer: OPTION C IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: A work that reports on the results of a research study to evaluate interventions or exposures on biomedical or health-related outcomes. The two main types of clinical studies are interventional studies (clinical trials) and observational studies. While most clinical studies concern humans, this publication type may be used for clinical veterinary articles meeting the requisites for humans.
Any number of entities (members) considered as a unit.
Drugs intended for human or veterinary use, presented in their finished dosage form. Included here are materials used in the preparation and/or formulation of the finished dosage form.
Compounds that inhibit HYDROXYMETHYLGLUTARYL COA REDUCTASES. They have been shown to directly lower CHOLESTEROL synthesis.
Compounds that inhibit HYDROXYMETHYLGLUTARYL COA REDUCTASES. They have been shown to directly lower CHOLESTEROL synthesis.

A class of lipoproteins of small size (18-25 nm) and light (1.019-1.063 g/ml) particles with a core composed mainly of CHOLESTEROL ESTERS and smaller amounts of TRIGLYCERIDES. The surface monolayer consists mostly of PHOSPHOLIPIDS, a single copy of APOLIPOPROTEIN B-100, and free cholesterol molecules. The main LDL function is to transport cholesterol and cholesterol esters to extrahepatic tissues.
A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.
Any number of entities (members) considered as a unit.
Having been determined by measurement.
One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
